item.title: From PowerPoint to Demos Easily With Desktops
item.description: Introduction If you’ve ever tried to give a PowerPoint presentation and switch to your desktop to do a demo, you may have noticed that PowerPoint tends to fight with you to stay in slide show mode.

item.title: Launching Edge with different profiles using shortcuts
item.description: Find out how you create create shortcuts that will launch your Edge browser with a different profile. Bonus: find out how to configure your Stream Deck buttons to launch Edge, Teams, and conference calls using different browsers.

item.title: My Demo Checklist for PnP Calls
item.description: I’m not a great presenter. I have been working in IT for over thirty years, during which time I have done many technical demos… and failed many of them.

item.title: Getting rid of JSON validation errors on comments
item.description: Introduction If you’re an SPFx developer who uses Visual Studio Code, you may have noticed that the JSON files that the Yeoman generator creates contain comments to help you understand how to configure your manifest. The only problem is: JSON files aren’t supposed to have comments.

item.title: Working with rules in Microsoft Lists
item.description: Microsoft Lists will soon make it easy to create rules to react to changes in your lists. Find out what I’ve learned so far.

item.title: Adding support for theme variants in SPFx web parts
item.description: Like chameleons, SPFx web parts can change colors to adapt to changing environments and blend in. With a few lines of code and some knowledge of which semantic colors you can use, you can built awesome web parts that will look good no matter what theme (or theme variant) your site uses.
